title.native: BLEACH 千年血戦篇-訣別譚-
title.english: BLEACH: Thousand-Year Blood War - The Separation

description:
The second part of BLEACH: Sennen Kessen-hen.

After a brutal surprise attack by the forces of Quincy King Yhwach, the resident Reapers of the Soul Society lick their wounds and mourn their losses. Many of the surviving Soul Reaper captains train to battle without their Bankai, the ultimate technique wielded by the fiercest warriors.

In the previous assault, Ichigo Kurosaki narrowly managed to help fend off Yhwach's fearsome wrath. However, to ultimately defeat his godly adversary and save his allies, Ichigo must now undergo severe training that will push him beyond his physical, emotional, and mental limits.

Though Yhwach already holds the upper hand in this ongoing blood feud, he also successfully recruits Uryuu Ishida, Ichigo's close friend and rival, to be his successor. Yhwach strikes out once again at the weakened Soul Society, intent on finally obliterating his long-standing enemies. As Ichigo struggles to attain new power, the Soul Reaper captains fight for survival and borrowed time.

(Source: MAL Rewrite)
synonyms: BLEACH: Thousand Year Blood War Part 2
BLEACH 千年血戦篇 第2クール

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: War
tags.description: Partly or completely set during wartime.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Mythology
tags.description: Prominently features mythological elements, especially those from religious or cultural tradition.

tags.name: Afterlife
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the afterlife.

tags.name: Transgender
tags.description: Features a character whose gender identity differs from the sex they were assigned at birth.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Ghost
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a ghost.

tags.name: Zombie
tags.description: Prominently features reanimated corpses which often prey on live humans and turn them into zombies.

tags.name: Femboy
tags.description: Features a boy who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of girls.

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: Gender Bending
tags.description: Prominently features a character who dresses and behaves in a way characteristic of another gender, or has been transformed into a person of another gender.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Kudo_M_) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kudo_m_/) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCVcxdd04vCuhr-1t7mDh3gg)

Originating from [Artland](https://anilist.co/studio/8/). Most known for his work on the [Bleach](https://anilist.co/anime/269/) franchise.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/124182562)

An extremely prolific animator often appearing in dozens of shows yearly.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/若林厚史)

Veteran Japanese animator, storyboard artist, and director. After joining [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/) and then [Tatsunoko Production](https://anilist.co/studio/103/), Wakabayashi finally landed at [Studio Pierrot](https://anilist.co/studio/1/), where he was considered the backbone of the studio's animation in the 90s. 

He is known for his bombastic animation style, which makes the designs he draws look malleable and often exaggerated. He was influenced by animators such as [Takashi Nakamura](https://anilist.co/staff/102031/) and [Kouji Morimoto](https://anilist.co/staff/100066/), and he is also a friend of [Norio Matsumoto](https://anilist.co/staff/100991/). His direction is inspired by Japanese live-action cinema as well as French directors such as Luc Besson.

Wakabayashi gained considerable notoriety on the NARUTO series, which he was invited to work on by [Hayato Date](https://anilist.co/staff/100843/) after a chance meeting at Pierrot. He is best known for storyboarding and directing episode 167 of [NARUTO: Shippuuden](https://anilist.co/anime/1735/): Naruto vs. Pain.

His main focus in anime these days is more on storyboarding, as he feels that the changes in the anime industry do not allow him to animate as freely as he used to.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/若林厚史)

Veteran Japanese animator, storyboard artist, and director. After joining [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/) and then [Tatsunoko Production](https://anilist.co/studio/103/), Wakabayashi finally landed at [Studio Pierrot](https://anilist.co/studio/1/), where he was considered the backbone of the studio's animation in the 90s. 

He is known for his bombastic animation style, which makes the designs he draws look malleable and often exaggerated. He was influenced by animators such as [Takashi Nakamura](https://anilist.co/staff/102031/) and [Kouji Morimoto](https://anilist.co/staff/100066/), and he is also a friend of [Norio Matsumoto](https://anilist.co/staff/100991/). His direction is inspired by Japanese live-action cinema as well as French directors such as Luc Besson.

Wakabayashi gained considerable notoriety on the NARUTO series, which he was invited to work on by [Hayato Date](https://anilist.co/staff/100843/) after a chance meeting at Pierrot. He is best known for storyboarding and directing episode 167 of [NARUTO: Shippuuden](https://anilist.co/anime/1735/): Naruto vs. Pain.

His main focus in anime these days is more on storyboarding, as he feels that the changes in the anime industry do not allow him to animate as freely as he used to.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ShiroSAGISU_twi)

__Non-Anime Credits:__ 
- Music composer for ''Neon Genesis Evangelion'' (N64, VG) (Japanese) 
- Music composer for ''Shining Force Neo'' (VG)
- Music composer for ''Attack on Titan (live-action movie)''
- Music composer for'' Attack on Titan II: End of the World (live-action movie)''
- Music composer for ''Shin Godzilla''
- Music composer for ''Shin Ultraman''

[Profile](https://asahi-pro.co.jp/creator/yamada-kazuhiro)

Affiliated with Asahi Production.

_Note: Not to be confused with the other [composite artist](https://anilist.co/staff/252146/) by the same name._

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/124182562)

An extremely prolific animator often appearing in dozens of shows yearly.
Veteran animator specialized in effects animation.
Veteran animator specialized in effects animation.

[Website](https://www.wodband.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/wodofficial7) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/wodofficial7/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC9akgSn0CzVFhDyQpEQ02ZQ)

w.o.d. are a Japanese rock band, formed by Takuya Saito (lead vocals, guitar) Ken Mackay (bass) and Motoyoshi Nakashima (drums, vocals). Releasing their first self titled album “webbing off duckling” in 2018, the trio showed up in numerous festivals and shows throughout Japan. After releasing their second album “1994” and third album “LIFE IS TOO LONG”, w.o.d. established their own style and solid sound gaining a loyal fan base.

(Source: Official Site)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Yuki_Jouet) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/yoh_kamiyama/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCw1U9K3S8WVWp7REGaHIW0A) | [SoundCloud](https://soundcloud.com/uki3) | [Website](https://yohkamiyama.com/) | [Wiki (JP)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E7%A5%9E%E5%B1%B1%E7%BE%8A)

Yoh Kamiyama is a singer, lyricist, composer and arranger signed to Sony Music Associated Records.
